title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3: SECONDARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 3.3: By 2026,the MoE, relevant Government agencies and partners have increased capacity to provide uninterrupted, high- quality, inclusive, relevant and flexible education and skilling opportunities for adolescents (11â€“18 years) with a focus on the most deprived and children in humanitarian situations, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Digital Transformation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3 - Education: By 2026, girls and boys (4â€“18 years) access, participate in and learn from quality and inclusive education.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL ACADEMY FOR EDUCATIONAL MANAGEMENT NAEM

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
